title: Mother Calls For Tougher Domestic Violence Sentencing After Daughter’s Murder | 10 News+
description: Tabitha Acret has made it her mission to fight against domestic violence since the murder of her daughter, Mackenzie Anderson. She was 21 years old when her former partner, Tyrone Thompson, stabbed her 78 times inside her Newcastle unit in front of a toddler. Thompson was sentenced to 22 years and 6 months in jail, with a non-parole period of 15 and a half years. Since the ruling, Mackenzie’s mother has worked tirelessly to change the system and that reform has now arrived. title: Chaos In Canberra: Pauline Hanson Wears Burqa In Senate, Environmental Reforms Stalled | 10 News+
description: There has been chaos in Canberra today, as Pauline Hanson was ejected from the Senate after entering the chamber wearing a burqa. Labor’s environmental reforms have also been stalled, while Environment Minister Murray Watt remains defiant, saying he is determined to pass the new laws this week. title: Ukrainian, US & European Officials 'Make Substantial Progress' In Peace Deal Talks | 10 News+
description: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio says "substantial progress" was made in Geneva after top Ukrainian, US and European officials met to discuss Donald Trump's 28-point peace plan for Ukraine. It comes after Kyiv and its allies expressed concern over what they saw as major concessions to Russia, and pressed for changes. Ukrainian forces fighting on the frontline are outrightly rejecting the idea of giving up land they currently control to their enemy. title: Teen Stabbed To Death In Sydney, Ukraine Peace Talk Progress, Cocaine Found At Sea | 10’s Late News
description: Tonight on 10’s Late News – a teenager has died after being stabbed outside a school in Sydney and another teen has been arrested, the US and Ukraine have described their talks as ‘productive’ as they work through a 28-point peace plan, tropical cyclone Fina is about to make landfall in remote Western Australia, and the popular holiday destination that’s about to introduce a “tourist tax”. title: Family Living Off The Grid In Italy Has Children Removed Due To “Alternative Lifestyle” | 10 News
description: A family living in the Italian countryside is at the centre of a legal battle – after the courts ruled their “alternative lifestyle” was a danger to the children. Australian Catherine Birmingham and her British husband Nathan Trvallion bought a property in the Abruzzo region of Italy in 2021. title: The Dangers Of Celebrity-Endorsed Microneedling | 10 News+
description: Radiofrequency microneedling is sold as the 'less scary' alternative to surgery and endorsed by celebrities like Kim Kardashian. However, this has not been the experience of a woman named Sarah, whose dermatologist says the process compromised the oil glands in her face, causing permanent damage. title: Dharmendra, Legendary Bollywood Actor, Dies At 89 | 10 News
description: The legendary Bollywood actor Dharmendra Deol has died at age 89, with several other stars of the industry such as Amitabh Bachchan, Salman Khan and Amir Khan gathering at a crematorium with the body of Dharmendra for his funeral in Mumbai.  Widely known as Bollywood's "He-Man", Dharmendra was one of Indian cinema's biggest screen presences for decades, acting in more than 300 films across his career.  Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi and President Draupadi Murmu joined the Bollywood industry and its fans in sending their condolences in the wake of Dharmendra's death.

title: UN ‘Seriously Concerned’ Over Israeli Strike On Beirut Killing Hezbollah Military Leader | 10 News
description: The United Nations has stated it is “seriously concerned” over an Israeli strike that targeted a residential area in southern Beirut, killing five people including Hezbollah chief of staff Haytham Ali Tabtabai.  UN spokesman Stephane Dujarric said, “We urge all actors to exercise maximum restraint and to avoid any further escalation and remind the parties that civilians and civilian areas must not be targeted.”  Hundreds snaked through the streets of Beirut’s southern suburbs on Monday in a funeral procession to mourn Hezbollah’s top military commander and other fighters killed in the Israeli strike. title: 100,000 Without Power After Supercell Storm Lashes Queensland | 10 News
description: Almost 100,000 homes and businesses across Queensland have been left without power after a supercell storm brought destructive winds, giant hail, lightning and heavy rain on Monday afternoon.  Wind gusts of up to 135 km/h and hailstones of up to 12 centimetres were recorded, sending trampolines flying from backyards and leaving holes in buildings and vehicles.  Energex estimates it will take until Wednesday night to reconnect everyone who has lost electricity and the Bureau of Meteorology warns there could be more intense and destructive weather again this evening across large parts of south-east Queensland. title: At Least 8 Killed And Thousands Evacuated As Severe Floods Hit Thailand And Malaysia | 10 News
description: At least eight people have been killed in southern Thailand and more than 15,000 evacuated in Malaysia after heavy rain caused severe floods across Southeast Asia. Floodwaters reaching waist height have affected 10 provinces in Thailand and eight states in Malaysia. Thailand’s southern city of Hat Yai recorded its heaviest single-day rainfall in more than 300 years on Friday, with footage showing people wading through deep brown water as shops and motorbikes were submerged.
